result.execSummary:
The defendant Taylor G. Steffen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Taylor G. Steffen is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Taylor G. Steffen was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Taylor G. Steffen was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent to include Anger Management.  AODA/treatment per agent.
Expungment if law abiding & fine paid in full within 24 mos.. Upon successful completion of probation, record may be expunged, 973.015.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: 38 days jail credit if probation revoked

Defendant Taylor G. Steffen in court with attorney Jeremiah Wolfgang Meyer-O'Day.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State notes DE will be entering pleas today and states recs.  Atty Meyer-O'Day agrees and NC pleas are entered.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds guilty and sentences.

15CM23
Ct 1:  Dismissed
Cts 2 and 3:  NC
Probation for 2 years on each count concurrent to each other
Conditions of probation:
Costs of $443.00 x 2 to be paid per agent
AODA/Treatment per agent
Anger mangement counseling
DE to report to P&P today
***If successful on probation and no criminal law violations the case is to be expunged

14CM211
Dismissed/read-in
for leave to file additional motions

Pre-trial conference on February 20, 2015 at 11:15 am.
Return date on March 4, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Taylor G. Steffen by video from LEC with attorney Debra V. O'Rourke.  Defendant Taylor G. Steffen in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  DE does qualify for PD appt.  Advised rights to an attorney.  State requests cash bond.  Atty O'Rourke responds.  File set for pre-trial conference/return date.  $250.00 cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact w/G.S. or his residence or premises and absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances w/o valid prescription.  May go to residence one time upon prior notice and w/law enforcement to retrieve belongings if necessary.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 20, 2015 at 11:15 am.  Return date scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
